entry.title: Google loses bid to overturn low-cost patent licenses to Microsoft
entry.summary:
Both Microsoft and Google declined to comment on the decision.

The case has been broadly followed by the technology industry because it could affect how Google and others negotiate royalty rates on their technology.

Google appealed the verdict and the royalty rate to the 9th Circuit.

entry.title: Google apologises after homophobic comments on gay bar

entry.title: Telstra TV to take on Google, Apple
entry.summary:
Telstra is set to take on Apple and Google with a device that streams internet video services such as Netflix and Stan to home televisions.

The service will work much the same way as Google's Chromecast, with a device that plugs into TV sets and hosts apps that play catch-up and on-demand services as well as streaming content provided by Netflix, Stan, Presto and YouTube.

entry.title: Google+ account no longer needed to use other Google services
entry.summary: "We made a few choices that, in hindsight, we needed to rethink," reads a blog post from Bradley Horowitz, Google's vice-president of streams, photos and sharing,.

entry.title: Google forced to apologise after contractor threatens to remove gay bars from search engine

entry.title: Google Plus gets dismantled by tech giant
entry.summary: "But myself and many other users of the platform aren't concerned for the future of Google+."

entry.title: Google Plus gets dismantled by tech giant
entry.summary:
For many users, Google Plus accounts don't get all that many visits.

Now, Google seems to be indicating it, too, will be paying less attention to its social network.

On Monday, Google said it would move features once integrated into Google Plus out of the social network and into other Google services.

Photo features have already been moved to the newly introduced Google Photos.

Users will also no longer need a Google Plus account to comment on YouTube, long a point of contention among customers who felt as if they were being roped into using a social network they did not ask for.

entry.title: YouTube shakes off Google+
entry.summary:
The company announced Monday it will pull back Google+'s integration with Google products in an attempt to streamline the service, which has been panned by users who have been confused and annoyed at being forced into the network.

In the coming months, YouTubers will be able to create channels, upload videos and post comments with regular Google accounts.

And beginning Monday, YouTube comments won't appear on Google+ or be linked to publicly searchable Google+ pages.

"It doesn't make sense for your Google+ profile to be your identity in all the other Google products you use," he wrote on Google's blog.

entry.title: YouTube shakes off Google+
Google Gives Up on Google+ as a Facebook Rival
entry.summary: "In the coming months, a Google Account will be all you'll need to share content, communicate with contacts, create a YouTube channel and more, all across Google," the company said.

entry.title: Google getting whipped into shape by Wall Street veteran Ruth Porat
entry.summary:
Not only was she a chief financial officer and former head of Morgan Stanley's financial institutions group, but she had worked on many technology deals as a mergers and acquisitions specialist, including Google's initial public stock offering.

Pitz worked with Porat during the eight years he was a research analyst at Morgan Stanley, including the time when Google went public.

entry.title: Google rides in: See Mongolia from the back of a horse-drawn sled
entry.summary:
"Google hopes that bringing Street View to Mongolia will raise awareness of the country as an emerging destination for visitors around the world, and support the country's economic growth moving forward," said Google's Susan Pointer.

Photo: A Google Street View member walks with a specialized camera to record the surroundings of the Choijin Lama Museum in the Mongolian capital of Ulan Bator.

entry.title: Review: Google photo service is strong on search
entry.summary: The latest offering, Google Photos, isn't perfect.

entry.title: Review: Google photo service is strong on search
entry.summary: This product image provided by Google shows the search feature of the Google Photos mobile app.

entry.title: Review: Google photo service is strong on search
entry.summary:
NEW YORK (AP) - Google's new service for organizing and backing up images blends some of the best of what Apple and Yahoo have rolled out in recent months.

Photo services from Google, Yahoo and Apple all store copies of those photos and video online.

Recently, Google apologized when the service mistakenly labeled two black people as gorillas.

On the other hand, Google has the best tools for searching photos.

Here's a look at Google Photos and how it compares with Apple's and Yahoo's offerings.

Google also has tools to automatically create collages and animations out of batches of photos.

Google, Apple and Yahoo use computer software to tag photos to help you find them more easily.

Google and Apple use face-recognition technology to sort photos by individuals, while Yahoo knows only that there's someone there - not who.

entry.title: Google Maps Now Shows You Everywhere You've Been
Google's new "timeline" feature
Google shares gain a record $65 billion
entry.summary: Google's stock roared out of a long slumber Friday to produce the biggest shareholder windfall in U.S. history as investors rewarded the Internet company for promising to curb its spending on risky projects.

entry.title: Google shareholders revel in record 1-day windfall of $65.1B
entry.summary:
A 16 percent surge in Google's publicly traded stock translated into an additional $65.1 billion in shareholder wealth, on paper at least.

Google's gigantic run-up came after the Mountain View, California, company reported quarterly earnings that topped analyst estimates for the first time since late 2013.

The company's inability to hit the targets that steer investors had raised doubts about Google that had caused its stock to lag the rest of the market since the end of 2013.

Although Google has still been making plenty of money, many investors believed the company needed to clamp down on expenses.

entry.title: Nasdaq logs best week in nearly nine months as Google jumps
entry.summary: Google rose $97.84, or 16 percent, to $699.62.

entry.title: Google gains billions in value as YouTube drives ad growth
entry.summary: Google's class A shares chalked up their largest single-day percentage change in more than seven years on Friday.

entry.title: Google propels Nasdaq to another record high close

entry.title: After 2nd-quarter results, Google looks set to gain a record $50B in market value Friday
entry.summary:
NEW YORK - Google is already one of the largest companies in the world, and on Friday it's making one of the largest stock market moves ever.

That pushed Google's Class A stock above $700 for the first time.

entry.title: Etsy shares spike after Google mention
entry.summary:
Shares of e-commerce website Etsy jumped as much as 30 percent on Friday thanks to a nod from Google during its quarterly conference call.

"It started with (the) Google commentary last night," Wedbush analyst Gil Luria said, adding that short sellers closing their bets were driving the stock up further.

entry.title: US stocks mixed open mixed as investors assess earnings

The results ended six consecutive quarters in which Google's earnings missed analysts' estimates.

Google rose $87, or 14.6 percent, to $690.

entry.title: Google boosts Nasdaq futures; Dow, S&P flat
entry.summary: * Google jumped 12 percent to $674.55, poised to open at a record high, a day after its profit beat forecasts for the first time in six quarters and the company said it would be more disciplined on spending.

entry.title: Google rallies as profit boosted by ad revenue
entry.summary: Google's said last night that its expenses rose 10% to $12.9 billion in the second quarter to the end of June from the year-ago quarter, and remained at 73% of revenue.

entry.title: Google self-driving car involved in first injury accident
entry.summary: FILE - In this May 13, 2015, file photo, Google's self-driving Lexus car drives along street during a demonstration at Google campus in Mountain View, Calif.

entry.title: Google self-driving car involved in first injury accident
entry.summary: Google has invested heavily as a pioneer of self-driving cars, technology it believes will be safer and more efficient than human drivers.

entry.title: Google self-driving car involved in first injury accident
entry.summary:
Google revealed Thursday that one of its self-driving car prototypes was involved in an injury accident for the first time.

In the collision, a Lexus SUV that the tech giant outfitted with sensors and cameras was rear-ended in Google's home city of Mountain View, where more than 20 prototypes have been self-maneuvering through traffic.

Google's SUV was going about 15 mph in self-driving mode behind two other cars as the group approached an intersection with a green light.

The Google car and the other car in front of it also stopped.

Google has said that its car has not caused any of the collisions -- though in 2011 an employee who took a car to run an errand rear-ended another vehicle while the Google car was out of self-driving mode.

entry.title: Google self-driving car involved in first injury accident
entry.summary:
In 11 of the 14, Google said its car was rear-ended.

Within about a second, a fourth vehicle rear-ended the Google car at about 17 mph.

entry.title: Google's 2Q signals new era of austerity with new CFO
entry.summary: Thursday's release of Google's report covering that period indicates that Porat already may be shaking things up.

entry.title: Google's 2Q signals new era of austerity with new CFO
entry.summary:
Google Inc. on Thursday, July 15, 2015 reported second-quarter earnings of $3.41 billion.

Investors were delighted with the breakthrough and Porat's encouraging remarks about reining in Google's expenses.

entry.title: Google's 2Q signals new era of austerity with new CFO
entry.summary:
Google could have been making more money all along if the growth in its expenses hadn't consistently been rising faster than its revenue, Gillis said.

Expenses now seem more likely to rise at or below the pace of Google's revenue increases, based on Porat's remarks to analysts Thursday.

entry.title: Google profit trumps estimates on ad revenue growth
Google's 2nd-quarter results indicate new CFO may clamp down on spending to boost earnings
entry.summary: Google's operating expenses climbed 13 percent from last year in the second quarter, slightly eclipsing an 11 percent increase in the company's revenue to $17.7 billion.

entry.title: Google's 2Q signals new era of austerity with new CFO
entry.summary:
Investor hopes for a more austere Google are largely tied to the arrival of a new chief financial officer, Ruth Porat.

She joined Google in late May, about two-thirds of the way through the Internet company's second quarter.

entry.title: Google's 2nd-quarter results indicate new CFO may clamp down on spending to boost earnings
entry.summary: Excluding stock compensation expense and several other items, Google earned $6.99 per share - topping the average estimate of $6.70 per share among analysts surveyed by FactSet.

entry.title: Google profit tops analyst estimates as company curbs costs
entry.summary:
The shares of Mountain View, Calif.-based Google rose as much as 8 per cent in extended trading after the report.

Second-quarter profit was $3.93-billion, compared with $3.35-billion a year earlier, Google said.

entry.title: Google's second quarter: What to watch
entry.summary: Google's second quarter: What to watch Analysts expect Google to earn $6.70 a share, excluding certain expenses, according to Thomson Reuters.

entry.title: Google wins dismissal of Android privacy lawsuit
Google wins dismissal of Android privacy lawsuit
entry.summary:
Google did not immediately respond to a similar request.

Grewal said it would unfairly prejudice Google to let the plaintiffs amend their lawsuit again.

The case is In re: Google Inc Privacy Policy Litigation, U.S. District Court, Northern District of California, No.

entry.title: Google unveils buying button in mobile shopping ads
entry.summary: Participating merchants can still gather information about customers using Google's buying button.

entry.title: Google unveils buying button in mobile shopping ads
entry.summary: SAN FRANCISCO - Google is introducing a way for shoppers browsing on their smartphones to buy merchandise by tapping on a button included in the ads appearing in its search results.

entry.title: Google unveils buying button in mobile shopping ads
Google Unveils 'Buy' Button, Host of New Shopping Features
entry.summary: The eagerly awaited "buy" feature, which Google said it was testing with a few retailers, uses saved payment credentials from the user s Google Account for transactions.

entry.title: Google unveils 'buy' button, new shopping features
entry.summary:
Google on Wednesday unveiled a new feature called "Purchases on Google," which allows shopper to buy items directly from mobile search ads.

The additional information will be available on Google Chrome for Android this month, with iOS support to follow in the coming months, the company said.

Google also said its Google Now service is offering location-based information, including on discounts on items and the working hours of stores a user is close to.

Google also said it would work with online e-commerce companies such as eBay, and direct customers to these companies' mobile apps instead of their websites.

entry.title: Google alters name of disputed South China Sea reef
Google removes Chinese name for disputed shoal
Google removes Chinese name for disputed South China Sea reef Scarborough Shoals
entry.summary: The BBC quoted a separate Google statement which said: "We understand that geographic names can raise deep emotions which is why we worked quickly once this was brought to our attention."

entry.title: Google tests driverless cars in Austin _ with safety drivers
entry.summary:
The driverless car will operate a few square miles north and northeast of downtown Austin, Google said in a statement.

Google did not say exactly where the driverless cars would be tested.

entry.title: Google tests driverless cars in Austin _ with safety drivers
entry.summary:
Google Inc. has selected Texas as the latest testing site for its self-driving car project, the company announced Tuesday.

The company is also testing several dozen self-driving cars on streets in Mountain View, California, where Google is based.

entry.title: Google testing self-driving prototype cars in Texas
entry.summary:
Google has been testing self-driving prototypes since 2009, mainly around its Silicon Valley headquarters in Mountain View, Calif.

Google and other automotive manufacturers and suppliers have said the technology to build self-driving cars should be ready by 2020.

Google executives have said the company does not want to build its own self-driving cars, but would prefer to find a development and production partner.

The Google self-driving cars have humans on board who can assume manual control of the vehicles if necessary.

entry.title: Google debuts carpooling service in Israel
